result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin C Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to any sentence, STRAIGHTTIME, with credit for 6 days served.
Defendant to participate in 18 MONTHS of the VTC program.

miscConds.notes:
* All mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA surcharge) and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Court waived all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.
* Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT TWO; Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $350.00 during probation or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept. 
* All mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA surcharge) and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Court waived all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

timeConds.notes: * AS TO COUNT TWO; Court ordered the defendant to serve 210 DAYS in the House of Correction. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED 196 DAYS of the condition time. Court ORDERED defendant to serve 14 days in the House of Correction, forthwith. Release for Huber.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin C Hernandez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin C Hernandez in court.  Attorney Mark P Murphy in court for Benjamin C Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
VETERAN COURT

Review hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Veterans Treatment Initiative Court DPA / DSA matter adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:50 am.

Defendant Benjamin C Hernandez in court.  Attorney Mark P Murphy in court for Benjamin C Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
VETERAN COURT

Review hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Veterans Treatment Initiative Court DPA / DSA matter adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:20 am.

VETERAN COURT
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to any sentence, STRAIGHTTIME, with credit for 6 days served. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS. Defendant to participate in 18 MONTHS of the VTC program.
AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent to any sentence, STRAIGHTTIME, with credit for 6 days served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.  Defendant to participate in 18 MONTHS of the VTC program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* AS TO COUNT TWO; Court ordered the defendant to serve 210 DAYS in the House of Correction. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED 196 DAYS of the condition time. Court ORDERED defendant to serve 14 days in the House of Correction, forthwith.  Release for Huber.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* AS TO COUNT TWO; Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 18 months.
* AS TO COUNT TWO; Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 18 months. 
* Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample.
* All mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA surcharge) and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Court waived all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges. 

AS TO COUNT TWO; Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $350.00 during probation or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Benjamin C Hernandez in court.  Attorney Mark P Murphy in court for Benjamin C Hernandez.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNTS ONE AND TWO; Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed.  Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-21-2022

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered defendant to continue working with JusticePoint pretrial services. Court orders defendant to no driving without a valid drivers license and insurance. Previously set bail conditions to continue.

Defendant Benjamin C Hernandez in court with attorney Mark P Murphy.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a entry into VTC. Due to reasons stated on the record, defense requested an adjournment. State did not object. Court adjourned the hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed: Early Intervention Program VTC OWI Enhanced Probation Agreement
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: Defendant's Supporting Documents
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.17.22

Defendant Benjamin C Hernandez in court with attorney Mark P Murphy.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel informed the court that case may be referred to VTC.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Attorney Murphy has provided defendant with the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Benjamin C Hernandez in court with Attorney Mark P Murphy.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Deputy A. Randolph.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated April 19, 2022 - received
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant has four cases before the court.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for preliminary hearing.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Benjamin C Hernandez in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Benjamin C Hernandez in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin C Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.
